meanings.definition: To defeat or outwit by cunning or deceit.
meanings.sent1: She outschemed her opponent in the chess game by using a clever strategy.
meanings.sent2: The detective outschemed the criminal and solved the case.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox outschemed the sly rabbit in a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking outschemed the tricky situation, saving the day.
meanings.sent5: He outschemed his rival by coming up with a brilliant plan at the last minute.

meanings.definition: To surpass in scheming or planning.
meanings.sent1: The mastermind outschemed all others in the art of planning elaborate heists.
meanings.sent2: She always outschemed her colleagues when it came to organizing events.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon outschemed the campers by stealing their snacks without being caught.
meanings.sent4: His strategic mind outschemed his opponents in the game of chess.
meanings.sent5: The cunning spy outschemed the enemy by creating a complex diversion.
